title: Greater Albion Releases Bonning. 40 percent Introductory Discount
content:
Greater Albion Typefounders has just released Bonning on [Myfonts.Com](http://web.archive.org/web/20100203003757/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/gatf/bonning/). Bonning is a Roman face full of the spirit of the 1920s.

It was inspired by a (real)estate agent’s For Sale board seen in an old sepia photograph from that era and combines visual flair and period with good clear legibility.

A range of Opentype features including alternate forms, old style numbers and fractions, as well as discretionary and standard ligatures are included. Three weights are offered, including a shadowed black form are offered, all in a choice of three widths. It’s the ideal face for signage with a period feel, as well as posters, headings and feature paragraphs.

A full (and fully licensed) version of Bonning Wide Bold can be downloaded completely free of charge from [Myfonts.Com](http://web.archive.org/web/20100203003757/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/gatf/bonning/)  
. The restof the family can be purchased there.

In the meantime Greater Albion's [blog](http://web.archive.org/web/20100203003757/http:/gatf.wordpress.com/) has some examples of the Bonning family in use.

4/4/09 = We're now running a 40% introductory discount on Bonning at [Myfonts.Com](http://web.archive.org/web/20100203003757/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/gatf/bonning/).
author: Rasendyll
